entry.title: Reset vsyncs_to_skip_ when it stops BeginFrames or has a new CVDisplayLink
entry.content:
If the preferred frame interval is different from the monitor default,

we skip vsyncs to achieve the preferred frame rate. The skip count

should be reset to 0 when it stops and restarts BeginFrames, or

switches to a different monitor.

entry.title: Allow dialog delegate callbacks to decide if callback should close
entry.content:
There are several cases where callers don't want the dialog to close on

accept. The current best solution is to sub-class DialogDelegate,

overriding Accept/Cancel. This CL exposes this functionality directly in

the DialogDelegate by allowing SetAcceptCallback to take a

OnceCallback.

entry.title: Recognize Rust third-party deps
entry.content:
These have a different directory pattern to other third-party

dependencies. Recognizing that pattern made the regular expression even

harder to follow, so this CL uses `re.VERBOSE` and some comments to help

explain it.



This required an update to include `License File:` in `third_party/rust/serde_json_lenient/v0_1/README.chromium`, as seemingly the `License` field is not sufficient. A similar change is probably required for other crates, but this was sufficient to get cronet building. Followup is in https://crbug.com/1464748.

entry.title: /build/rust: Ensure all paths are relative
entry.content:
Absolute paths make sandboxing, remote execution and caching

impossible, because they cannot be reproduced on other systems

and also vary by user and location of the current Chromium

checkout. It's best to use relative paths only.



With these fixes, the generated Ninja files no longer contain any

absolute paths that refer to my home directory, at least on Linux.



I verified that the build still works by building `all` target.



CQ run also passed for the pre-split CL: crrev.com/c/4682679



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: Accessibility: Implement Dictation keyboard improvements
entry.content:
This change implements improvements to Dictation's keyboard shortcuts

(Search + D combination and the Dictation key on supported keyboards).

If Dictation is enabled, those keys toggle Dictation normally (current

behavior). If Dictation is disabled, those keys will enable the

Dictation feature and show the network dialog if needed (new

behavior).



To do so, this change:

1. Adds a method called EnableOrToggleDictation(), which follows the

behavior described above.

2. Adds automated tests at the AccessibilityController and

AccessibilityManager levels.

3. Updates the accelerator action and associated methods to match the

new method name.

4. Adds a feature flag so that the new behavior is protected behind

the flag.



Please see the UI mocks [1] for more details on desired behavior. Note

that the mocks show updated dialog strings and two additional pieces

of UI - those changes are left out of this change and will be added

in a follow-up.



[1] https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1mRnYcRpyzbY-EjzptCP3KRB5I7v_rM9Kl2zqhhQVZUY/edit#slide=id.p

entry.title: Remove SK_USE_LEGACY_TILE_IMAGEFILTER flag
entry.content:
Most of the images have very minor differences in AA around circle

boundaries. These are the result of a minor effect of the staged

which allows for remembering the impact of a crop, instead of assuming

a blend or color filter fills out unbounded no matter what. This leads

to slightly different offscreen image dimensions and can explain those

anti-alising differences.



feTile and filters-tile-01-b show more radical image differences, but

I believe they are a general improvement. Previously the tile image

filter would round out any fractional tiling rectangle to integer

values. This leads to transparent gaps between tiles that is entirely

dependent on the display scale. The new tile filter rounds in to avoid

introducing transparent gaps.



However, both round-in and round-out can lead to inaccurate tiling

over large distances relative to what should have been produced by

remembering the floating point tiling boundary. skbug.com/11249 tracks

a longer term effort to let image filters remember the original

geometry instead of being locked to the pixel grid.



The tiling error accumulation is present in filters-tile-01-b both

previously and with the new image. Rounding in produces an image that

more closely matches the W3C expected image of https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/svg/W3C-SVG-1.1/filters-tile-01-b-w3c.png;l=1?q=filters-tile-01-&sq=&ss=chromium



Of note is that the linux layout tests are not run at a 100% display

scale (I believe it's 125 or 150%). Manually rendering the SVG with

both the new and old tile implementation exactly matches the W3C

expected image.



Bug: skia:9282

entry.content:
Clarifies that a few instances of identity transforms in

CardboardRenderLoop are intentional and because we don't expect the

content to be scaled between the texture we setup and the texture that

the page sends us back. This is a necessary scaling step that happens on

ARCore, since we expand the camera image a little bit to fill the full

screen size, but is not needed on the other platforms.



Also removed one convenience interface for GVR to simplify the API

surface and added a comment there as well.

entry.title: Reduce work updating pending surfaces
entry.content:
When BeginFrameSource ticks it sends out OnBeginFrame() messages to all

BeginFrameObservers. Each CompositorFrameSink that gets OnBeginFrame()

will send out a SurfaceDamageExpected message to all SurfaceObservers.

Each window has a DisplayDamageTracker that is a SurfaceObserver. Even

though only the window that is embedding a particular frame sink cares

about the expected damage, all of DisplayDamageTrackers receive

OnSurfaceDamageExpected() message. This may trigger recomputing pending

surfaces via DisplayDamageTracker::HasPendingSurfaces(). When there are

many windows open at the same time this is a significant amount of

wasted work every vsync.



Since DisplayDamageTracker is linked to specific BeginFrameSource we can

filter out surface damage earlier based on the begin frame source_id.

This will ensure pending surfaces are only recomputed when a change is

possible.



A trace was recorded on Linux release build without DCHECKs at both ToT

[1] and ToT with this CL applied [2]. In the traces there were 10

windows open, 9 had poster circle animating and the tenth had the trace

viewer to record the trace. The average CPU time in

DisplayDamageTracker::SurfaceDamageExpected was 4.77us at ToT and 1.99us

with this CL applied.



[1] https://ui.perfetto.dev/#!/?s=b163f091c6faedabdfc011587c000febfea519956e2ad02b228cdacd765cc265

[2] https://ui.perfetto.dev/#!/?s=323b3c1378ff0de5a50164d961aa0975e3eb0221e63e2f2718969bf74d4db163

settings, but overlooked the fact that callers to

enterprise policies specifically (in most cases anyway).

calling sites, reverting the behavior in

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Prevent the hanging progress bar in password settings
entry.content:
What caused the problem: The mPasswordSerializationStarted was reset in

ExportFlow.onCreate, which is called only once when user enters the

settings page. And so when user started the export flow the second time,

the serialization never started at all.

mPasswordSerializationStarted needs to be reset in

ExportFlow.startExporting, because it might be called multiple times.

entry.title: [views] Fix the leading position hints in MenuController
entry.content:
Currently, for a given menu depth, whether or not child menus

have opened in a leading direction are stored in

MenuController::State::open_leading. This is updated synchronously

in MenuController::OpenMenuImpl().



This is unique as State tracks the current selected menu item and is

updated asynchronously. For this reason the state tracking open

directions has been moved onto MenuController directly.





Currently it is assumed that the length of open_leading matches

the current maximum depth of a given menu, and that the value at

the end is the open direction for the menu at maximum depth.



However this assumption is not correct. It can be the case that

a menu item is selected at depth smaller than the current maximum

depth. This has the effect of updating open_leading in a way that

makes it inconsistent with the assumption stated above.



Specifically, the list is trimmed to [selected depth - 1]. However

since the selected depth can be smaller than the maximum depth,

the open_leading state will start to misrepresent the opened

leading direction at a given depth.





With this CL, the vector maintains the open direction at a

given depth. This is not trimmed when a new menu item is committed

as the selected item. This avoids open direction state getting out

of sync with the current depth of the menu.



This also introduces the MenuOpenDirection enum for improved

readability.



Bug: 1463091

Change-Id: Idcfcc79d21890383d08c3679a6c59bd6fa6f88e1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4685446

entry.title: Android: Update "Leave Incognito mode?" dialog type to TAB
entry.content:
This CL changes the type of the "Leave Incognito mode?" dialog from APP

to TAB, as the dialog is opened in the context of the current tab and

should be dismissed if the tab changes in the background. Using ModalDialogType.APP unfortunately prevents that as such dismissal logic

are handled by TabModelLifetimeHandler, which works on TAB based

dialogs.



Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/11LZQWlu3k4Nu9OxR4nxOoxYolhFc16OD/view?usp=sharing

Bug: 1422272

entry.title: Refactor all the PasswordGenerationPopupViewTests.
entry.content:
The flakiness in PasswordGenerationPopupViewAxTest.PopupInAxTree was

caused by the DCHECK in the PasswordGenerationAgent. Now it's updated to

CHECK.

The problem was that the browser process was testing generation UI

without any setup in the renderer. As the result occasionally renderer

got a call to prefill the generated password. The renderer wasn't able

to do it and crashed.

Now the tests excersice more production code instead of the concrete UI

controller class. The renderer is set up properly as the result.



Fixed: 1462880

entry.title: /third_party/boringssl: Ensure all paths are relative
entry.content:
Absolute paths make sandboxing, remote execution and caching

impossible, because they cannot be reproduced on other systems

and also vary by user and location of the current Chromium

checkout. It's best to use relative paths only.



With these fixes, the generated Ninja files no longer contain any

absolute paths that refer to my home directory, at least on Linux.



I verified that the build still works by building `all` target.



CQ run also passed for the pre-split CL: crrev.com/c/4682679



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=davidben@chromium.org

entry.title: [FPS] Remove usage of SameParty attribute from network restart tests
entry.content:
This changes the focus of this test slightly since it no longer relies

on any information provided by First-Party Sets, but the usage of

kWaitForFirstPartySetsInit forces the network service to delay all

outgoing cookie-carrying requests until FPS has been initialized. So,

the test still does ensure that the Network Service does properly

reinitialize its notion of FPS after a restart.

entry.title: [mullet m2] Add UI only for address and name group filling suggestions.
entry.content:
We have 3 group filling suggestion types:



1. Address: When selected will fill all address related fields.

2. Name: When selected will fill all name related fields.

3. Phone number: Same as above but for phone number.



1# and 2# are conditionally displayed as their own suggestion in the new popup.



1# is displayed if the field is an address field while 2# if it is a name field.



3# is not handled yet because it behaves differently from other group suggestions as it does not have its own "Fill full phone" entry.



demo-ish: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTMyNzk3NjU4NjU0MzEwNHw1MjliYTMxNi05NA



UX fill full name: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3sto2b5XbuW6WKX

UX fill full address: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/yY3kmPb2McRR643

entry.title: Add some non-const getters to SVGTextPositioningElement to match IDL semantics.
entry.content:
This duplicates some getters on SVGTextPositioningElement to have

non-const semantics, to match the semantics of WebIDL, where the return

value is not const. It retains the const versions because they are used

by C++ callers.



I believe this sort of code *should* be a compilation error, and I have

work in progress on a CL to the bindings code to make it one. This is

one of two const-related changes in blink that needs to be made for that

CL. (There are other type-related changes.)



Bug: 1464089

entry.title: [First-Party Sets] Remove WebSocket support
entry.content:
First-Party Sets used to support a SameParty cookie attribute, and

supported a "normalization" step which transformed WSS URLs to HTTPS

URLs for the sake of determining membership in a First-Party Set.

Since SameParty is now unsupported, we can now remove the WSS

integration from First-Party Sets.

entry.title: Clean up replaced sizing special cases for (outermost) <svg> roots
entry.content:
NGBlockNode::GetReplacedSizeOverrideIfAny() is only called by

ComputeReplacedSizeInternal(), and in the case the node is an

LayoutSVGRoot it will only be called after the same checks

(GetContainerSize() or IsEmbeddedThroughFrameContainingSVGDocument())

has been performed already. Remove it.



Reorganize ComputeReplacedSize() to more explicitly check if the

root is the document element, since all the special-cases only apply for

that. Remove redundant IsDocumentElement() checks and turn the check in

LogicalSizeScaleFactorForPercentageLengths() into a CHECK().



Bug: 1458399

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Show the deletion dialog for exported passwords
entry.content:
The deletion dialog shows after the passwords have been exported.

It uses the PasswordStoreBridge to clear all passwords. That bridge was

first introduced for testing, but it was decided to use it here to avoid

adding cpp code to PasswordUIView and adding an interface to pass the

PasswordUIView all the way to the fragment who would invoke password

deletion.

CallbackDelayer, DialogManager, SingleThreadBarrierClosure and

TimedCallbackDelayer have been moved out of chrome_java.

> Revert "PreloadingDevTools: Disable prerendering for clients other than DevTools frontend"

> > PreloadingDevTools: Disable prerendering for clients other than DevTools frontend

> >

> > Prerendering introduced switching of FrameTreeNodes in the browser side

> > and frame targets in the CDP client side. If a CDP client unaware of

> > this logic and a prerendered page activated, it will cause unexpected

> > behaviors. For example, Puppeteer loses control. To mitigate this, this

> > CL disables prerendering if a target without tab target support is

> > attached. For more details, see [1].

entry.title: Add Kerberos ErrorType to the ShouldRetry() list
entry.content:
Add ERROR_UNKNOWN_KRB5_ERROR error type to the list of errors that

should trigger a retry of the AcquireKerberosTgt() method. The retry

logic is only applied to tickets added automatically, using the

KerberosAccounts policy.



This change will cause Chromebooks to retry when some unknown temporary

issue is preventing the device from adding a ticket. One example is the

"Resource temporarily unavailable (11)" from b/289742596, which is

related to some system resource like thread, memory address or network

socket.



The number of retries should not increase significantly with this

change, since it's still limited to 10 retries per policy update.

Additionally, UMA metrics show that this error corresponds to roughly 1%

of the results from AcquireKerberosTgt().



Bug: b:289742596

Change-Id: I42babd142f218e6127007d40583f0582216b48a0

Reviewed-by: Roman Sorokin

entry.title: [relaunch_notification] Fix interactive UI test on macOS and Linux
entry.content:
This test was failing on macOS devices that did not have Keystone

present because UpgradeDetector was not monitoring for updates. Now,

UpgradeDetector observes the BuildState on macOS regardless of

Keystone's presence. `GetInstalledVersion` will return the current

version if the Chromium updater is not being used and Keystone is not

present. This unblocks tests dependent on update notifications (e.g.,

RelaunchNotificationControllerUiTest).



This also makes update notifications work when the Chromium updater is

used and Keystone is not present on the system.



This test was also failing on Linux due to a race with the window

manager. To mitigate this, pump UI events after minimizing the browser

window -- simply waiting for the BrowserView's widget to become

deactivated is insuffient.



While we're at it:

- Disable notifications before teardown so that a restart isn't

triggered at the end of an otherwise passing test.

- Make the timing of the test a little more deterministic.

- Make a few members of RelaunchNotificationControllerUiTest static

because we can.

- Add a few more ASSERTs to the test to help diagnose failures more

easily.



Fixed: 1462892

Change-Id: Ia577e0f1b12340712a8b54109b3420c86a29684b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4677678

Commit-Queue: Greg Thompson

entry.title: /build/toolchain/apple: Ensure all paths are relative
entry.content:
Absolute paths make sandboxing, remote execution and caching

impossible, because they cannot be reproduced on other systems

and also vary by user and location of the current Chromium

checkout. It's best to use relative paths only.



With these fixes, the generated Ninja files no longer contain any

absolute paths that refer to my home directory, at least on Linux.



I verified that the build still works by building `all` target.



CQ run also passed for the pre-split CL: crrev.com/c/4682679



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=sdefresne@chromium.org

entry.title: Browsing Data Model: Tweak Media License & test more quota types
entry.content:
CL enables testing for fetching & deleting of more quota types,

including WebSQL, ServiceWorkers, and Media Licenses.



To enable Media License, some additional helpers are required in

the test, similar to the existing BrowsingDataRemover test.



As Media Licenses report as 0 size to the Quota Manager, they were

previously ignored by the QuotaHelper, which skips size 0 entries.



This CL thus also adjusts the QuotaHelper to retain 0 size entries,

which requires updating some tests based on the state of the SP flag,

as quota nodes may or may not be included in the CookiesTreeModel.



CL also removes some weird test logic that was comparing a static 0

to another static 0 in many places.



Bug: 1271155

Change-Id: I6075576268cb15d22e4f6e0706ff1fdfa5862bcf

entry.title: [reland^2] [rust] chrome://crash/rust on ChromeOS
entry.content:
This enables the first bytes of Rust in the Chromium binary itself

for ChromeOS. It simply enables a chrome://crash/rust URI handler

which users should not normally encounter.



We're enabling this carefully and progressively across platforms.



This is a reland of

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4654230

which was reverted because ChromeOS' distributed LTO did not support

non-thin archives such as Rust rlibs.



That's been fixed in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4665860



Bug: 1463749, 1368726

entry.title: Revert "[Local Network Access] Rename private to local in devtools observers"
entry.content:
This reverts commit dedc929d950335cb90fe5744700e9a240d2178f4.



Reason for revert: The spec has been renamed back to Private Network Access https://github.com/WICG/private-network-access/pull/106



Original change's description:

> [Local Network Access] Rename private to local in devtools observers

>

> In https://github.com/WICG/local-network-access/issues/91, we decided to

> rename Private Network Access to Local Network Access. The spec has

> already been renamed in

> https://github.com/WICG/local-network-access/pull/97. The latest spec:

> https://wicg.github.io/local-network-access/

>

> This CL renames PrivateNetwork to LocalNetwork in various devtools

> observers, and the places that use them.

>

> There are so many places to rename, so during the process, there will

> inevitably be inconsistencies. Hopefully, we shall resolve all of them

> soon.

>

> Bug: 1418287

entry.title: Redirect Imprivata logs to messages
entry.content:
Use the SYSLOG macro to redirect Imprivata debug logs to

/var/log/messages. This only happens if the debugLoggingEnabled

extension policy is enabled. Admins have this policy enabled in the

initial stages of setting up Imprivata, and adding the debug logs to

the messages file will improve the debugging experience of CEs, support

and admins.

Once Imprivata is set up and deployed to production,

debugLoggingEnabled can be disabled and logs will not be added to the

system logs any more.



Privacy approval: b/279975328



This CL also increases the log level of non-Imprivata extensions from

DEBUG to EVENT.



Bug: b/291047138, b/289234479

Change-Id: I319df4a45ba32a26d3fc16526a167a3cd81adb8b

entry.title: Fix flaky BidirectionalStream#testReadAndWrite
entry.content:
The source of the flakiness was a race condition between the networking thread finishing `onWriteCompleted` and the test thread reaching `setAutoAdvance(true)`.



This was the racy scenario:



1. Stream has started.

2. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextWriteStep();`

3. Networking thread calls `onStreamReady()` and unblocks the test thread.

4. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextReadStep();`.

5. Networking thread calls `onResponseHeadersReceived` which calls `startNextWrite()`.

6. `startNextWrite()` executes a write before `onResponseHeadersReceived` has finished.

7. `onResponseHeadersReceived` finishes and unblock the testing thread.

8. Testing thread calls `callback.setAutoAdvance(true), callback.startNextRead(stream), callback.blockForDone()` and blocks.

9. Testing thread hangs forever because there is another write waiting in-queue that must be triggered by `startNextWrite`.



This was the passing scenario:



1. Stream has started.

2. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextWriteStep();`

3. Networking thread calls `onStreamReady()` and unblocks the test thread.

4. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextReadStep();`.

5. Networking thread calls `onResponseHeadersReceived` which calls `startNextWrite()`.

6. `onResponseHeadersReceived()` executes a write before `startNextWrite` has finished.

7. `onResponseHeadersReceived` finishes and unblock the testing thread.

8. Testing thread calls `callback.setAutoAdvance(true), callback.startNextRead(stream), callback.blockForDone()` and blocks.

9. Networking thread executes `onWriteCompleted` and finds that autoAdvance is true which go ahead and execute the rest of write/read automatically and unblock the testing thread.



Current change scenario:



1. Stream has started.

2. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextWriteStep();`

3. Networking thread calls `onStreamReady()` and unblocks the test thread.

4. Test thread waits for `callback.waitForNextReadStep();`.

5. Networking thread calls `onResponseHeadersReceived` which calls `setAutoAdvance(true)` first then calls `startNextWrite()`.



This guarantee that whichever thread finish first, the write/read will be executed.



Change-Id: I6f384aaa872bad8111fb1c046323d1bd9c520b4c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4678908

Auto-Submit: Mohannad Farrag

entry.title: /build/toolchain: Ensure all paths are relative
entry.content:
Absolute paths make sandboxing, remote execution and caching

impossible, because they cannot be reproduced on other systems

and also vary by user and location of the current Chromium

checkout. It's best to use relative paths only.



With these fixes, the generated Ninja files no longer contain any

absolute paths that refer to my home directory, at least on Linux.



I verified that the build still works by building `all` target.



CQ run also passed for the pre-split CL: crrev.com/c/4682679



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=hans@chromium.org

entry.title: [Autofill] Fix limit in RationalizeCreditCardNumberOffsets()
entry.content:
Before this CL, Autofill wouldn't split a credit card number over

N x fields iff the sum of the maxlength is < 19.



This CL changes the `<` to `<=` because credit cards numbers can be

19 characters long.



Bug: 1419578
